column4: I'm ready to install hardy and I was hoping someone could help me with my parition set up
Sure!
How big of a space do you have available for Ubuntu?
Hint: type mro and push Tab on the keyboard and it will finish typing my  nickname and highlight it for me to see your posts easier.
Thanks
should I give the boot partition 20 gigs or more?

I would partition / for 20 gigs, swap for 512MB (or more if you don't have much RAM), and the rest for /home. Perhaps you might create a /backup and make the /home 80GB and the backup partition for regular backups.
20GB is plenty. You can get by with 10 but 20 will prevent problems later on.
I will give the os 20 gigs
Is this a server or a desktop?
I have four gigs of ram, but I was still thinking of having a swap
You need one. I would make it 256MB since you have 4GB. Also you would want to run a 64 bit version.
I'm worried about going 64 because of driver and software support
Most of the stuff I run has good 64 bit support. All the drivers run fine.
I'm on fiesty right now and the os can only see 3 gigs, but I'm fine with that
Thank so much, would you recommend that I set up the partitions before run the install or do it with the install disk?
They even made it so Flash works with 64 bit Firefox. It takes a little reading but you can get everything to work from searching wiki.ubuntu.com, the factoids on the ubotu bot, and ubuntuforums.org.
I have no problems with 64 bit.
Should I set up the partitions before I run the install disk or during the install?
I think during the install is fine.
Thanks for your help!!!  Here is goes!   Bye
In fact if you do any partition resizing through GParted, you will need to do it from the LiveCD.
